private_information: I operate primarily on blocks A, B, C, and D.
I can perform pickup, putdown, unstack, and stack actions and can carry one block at a time.
I observe and execute the steps assigned to me in the provided sequence when possible.
agent1.goal: Execute my assigned actions in the sequence and report observations needed to derive the final block arrangement.

private_information: I operate primarily on blocks E, F, G, and H.
I can perform pickup, putdown, unstack, and stack actions and can carry one block at a time.
I observe and execute the steps assigned to me in the provided sequence when possible.
agent2.goal: Execute my assigned actions in the sequence and report observations needed to derive the final block arrangement.

private_information: I coordinate the information and observations from agent1 and agent2 and assemble a single PDDL domain and problem.
I target the FastDownwards planner and must keep actions originating from different agents distinct in the PDDL encoding.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent observations and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards that capture the initial state and the derived final arrangement of the blocks.

public_information: Blocks world rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
The blocks involved are A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
Initial arrangement: A is on the table.
Initial arrangement: B is on the table.
Initial arrangement: C is on top of E.
Initial arrangement: D is on top of C.
Initial arrangement: E is on the table.
Initial arrangement: F is on top of H.
Initial arrangement: G is on top of B.
Initial arrangement: H is on the table.

The agents will execute the following actions in order: 1. pickup(A) 2. putdown(A) 3. unstack(F,H) 4. putdown(F) 5. pickup(A) 6. stack(A,F) 7. unstack(G,B) 8. putdown(G) 9. unstack(D,C) 10. stack(D,B).
The objective is to derive the final arrangement of each block after the sequence of actions.

observe.system_prompt: You are agent1 participating in a Blocks World task. You should not emit PDDL. Provide a concise report of the initial configuration of the blocks you observe, and list the actions from the global sequence that are assigned to you and any observations after you execute them.
observe.prompt: You are agent1. Use the public information to understand the world and use your private information to reason about the actions you are assigned. Report the initial positions of A, B, C, and D as you observe them and report the effects of the actions assigned to you. Assigned actions: 1 pickup(A), 2 putdown(A), 5 pickup(A), 6 stack(A,F), 7 unstack(G,B), 8 putdown(G), 9 unstack(D,C), 10 stack(D,B). Output a structured observation summary under the key obs_agent1.

observe.system_prompt: You are agent2 participating in a Blocks World task. You should not emit PDDL. Provide a concise report of the initial configuration of the blocks you observe, and list the actions from the global sequence that are assigned to you and any observations after you execute them.
observe.prompt: You are agent2. Use the public information to understand the world and use your private information to reason about the actions you are assigned. Report the initial positions of E, F, G, and H as you observe them and report the effects of the actions assigned to you. Assigned actions: 3 unstack(F,H), 4 putdown(F). Output a structured observation summary under the key obs_agent2.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert at producing PDDL domain and problem files for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the reports from the agents, reconstruct the global initial state, apply the provided action sequence if needed, and derive the final arrangement of all blocks. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownwards where the domain models the standard Blocks World and agent actions are kept distinct by namespacing agent-specific actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information and the observation summaries obs_agent1 and obs_agent2 to construct a consistent global initial state and to compute the final arrangement after the given action sequence. Keep actions that originate with different agents distinct by naming or namespacing them. Provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem where the initial state matches the given initial arrangement and the goal encodes the final arrangement derived from the action sequence. Target the FastDownwards planner and include typical requirements and typing where appropriate. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem> and output them as the pddl_orchestrator artifact.
